and possibly early delivery. Especially in lower-income settings, hypertensive disorders are the 
leading cause of infant mortality ( 191). Pre-eclampsia may also cause serious outcomes for the 
mother, such as kidney and liver problems, even progressing to stroke or seizures (eclampsia) 
if not treated. Hypertensive disorders such as pre-eclampsia are thought to account for up to 
40 000 maternal deaths per year.
